course_title: Foundations of Midwifery and Midwifery with Complex Pregnancy

learning_outcomes.description: Critically evaluate the importance of holistic assessment of maternal, and fetal/newborn well-being, which includes practice in the assessment of the physical, emotional, cultural and psychological needs of the woman and her baby, in the antenatal, intrapartum and post-natal periods, including complex health conditions.
Analyse effective ways of supporting the mother/newborn dyad to optimize physiological transition from intrauterine to extra uterine life including establishment of feeding.

Advocate for the role of the midwifery partnership to promote normal, non-interventional choices for women during labour, birth, and the postpartum including breastfeeding including communication, environment, support, assessment and monitoring

Investigate and critically review the role of the midwife and the need to consult and refer with other health professionals to provide safe comprehensive care for the woman with complexities in pregnancy, labour and the postpartum period, including rural and remote health services.

Analyse common medical conditions that women experience in pregnancy and their effect on both mother and baby and examine strategies in providing culturally responsive woman-centred care to women as they are challenged by and deal with the physical and psychological complications of high-risk birthing.

Using contemporary and appropriate evidence, critically examine the pathophysiology of, diagnosis, and evidence for treatment of, and expected outcomes associated with complex medical conditions of significance to midwifery practice.

Investigate and advocate for the importance midwives have in providing health promotion and prevention strategies for women with complex medical conditions including women from culturally diverse backgrounds.

Critically review how contemporary and relevant evidence can be used to inform midwifery care of women with complex health needs with a particular focus on the use of digital health technology to improve health outcomes.

assessments.due_date:
21/02/2025 1:00 pm

Assessment will be in person in the scheduled CBL session day 6 of the Foundations of Midwifery 2 Week Intensive Workshop.
assessments.task_description: This OSCA will assess the midwifery skill of an Abdominal palpation and Fetal Heart assessment. This assessment will be in person in the scheduled CBL session of the Foundations of Midwifery 2 Week Intensive Workshop.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please bring a copy of the assessment task to your OSCA where your lecturer will sign it off as completed. Completed signed assessment task will be submitted to gradebook.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This is an individual assessment and must be completed on your own device according to the UQ’s Academic Integrity Pledge. The quiz will include 10 multiple choice, and 10 short answer questions based on the content from the Foundations of Midwifery Intensive course. Students are required to achieve 50% accuracy within the allocated time of one hour to achieve a successful grade in this assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This will be an off campus, online non-invigilated assessment on the platform Blackboard Ultra submitted on this platform.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Health Complexity in Pregnancy Oral Presentation
assessments.due_date:
14/03/2025 - 30/05/2025

Presentations will be held over the semester weeks 3-11 during the PBL tutorial. Presentations are required to be submitted to gradebook for marking on the agreed presentation date.
assessments.task_description: The aim of this assessment is to develop your knowledge and understanding of the care and management of a woman/fetus/neonate with a complex health condition experienced in the antenatal, intrapartum, and postpartum periods. You will be required to present this knowledge in a group presentation, and awarded an individual grade. The oral presentation assessment for this course will be recorded in alignment with UQ policies and procedures.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Your power point slides are to be submitted to the blackboard course group discussion board and gradebook for marking purposes on the agreed presentation date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Digital Online On Campus Invigilated Exam
assessments.task_description: This examination will be held online using the INSPERA platform, the exam will be held on campus and will be invigilated. The exam will be administered by central exams during the semester exam block.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Foundations of Midwifery Practice 2 Week Pre-Semester Intensive Workshop

This Foundation course will require you to attend the two (2) week intensive pre-semester workshop February 10th - February 27th Monday/Wednesday/ Friday each week. The venue is the Whitty Building, Mater Hospital Campus, South Brisbane. Details will be sent once you are enrolled in the course. Workshop days for the course are Monday, Wednesday and Friday and attendance is mandatory.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
